title: uprecords: Shows duplicated entry and impossible values

sentences.text: on a netbook which I suspend to RAM quite often (not sure if that's relevant :-), I found the following strange output of uprecords:
The first entry seems to be duplicated more or less, leading to wrong uptime percentage (115%) and wrong downtime (-2 days).
I though can't find this duplicated entry in the
/var/spool/uptimed/records file, so I suspect a bug in the statistics part of uprecords:
Versions of packages uptimed depends on:
The uptime percentage and dowtime values are bogus, upstream is aware of that and I  believe they will be removed in the next release.
The double entry is puzzling though, thanks for reporting.
I wonder if that's just the addition of the current exact uptime at the moment you ran uprecords which tops out max recorded uptime + the display of the last recorded highest uptime.
On Fri, Jan 6, 2012 at 12:59 AM, Axel Beckert <abe@debian.org> wrote:
> on a netbook which I suspend to RAM quite often (not sure if that's > relevant :-), I found the following strange output of uprecords:
> The first entry seems to be duplicated more or less, leading to wrong > uptime percentage (115%) and wrong downtime (-2 days).
> I though can't find this duplicated entry in the
> /var/spool/uptimed/records file, so I suspect a bug in the statistics > part of uprecords:
> Versions of packages uptimed depends on:
I experienced this same bug fallowing:
Versions of packages uptimed depends on:
